Filtering Files by Wild Cards

Use the Wild Card Filename Filter dialog box (View | Filter | Wild Card) to view only the versioned files that match the specified wild card.

To filter files by wild cards:

  1. Select View | Filter | Wild Card. The Wild Card dialog box appears.

  2. Complete the fields in the dialog box as follows:

    Filename Pattern Enter a filter criteria using regular characters and any of the following wildcards:

    * for zero or more characters (for example, *.DLL for all file names with a .DLL extension);

    ? for any one character (e.g. TEST??.DLL for all file names with a pattern such as TEST01.DLL, TEST02.DLL);

    [-] for a range of characters (for example, [A-D]* for all file names that start with A, B, C, or D);

    [^] for a negative character set matching any character not enclosed (for example, [^A-D]* for all file names that do not start with A, B, C, or D).
    Ignore Case Select to view versioned files that match the filter pattern regardless of the case of the file name.


  3. Click OK.
